name: Magical Savant
description: You specialize your magical skills into a certain school of magic, gaining benefits based on the school you choose.  Additionally, your choice grants you a cantrip, for which Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting ability.  You can take this feat multiple times, and must choose a different school each time.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Blade Ward cantrip.

traits.name: Durable Abjurations
traits.description: When you cast an abjuration spell that requires concentration, you can't lose concentration on it as a result of taking damage.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Summon Mote cantrip.

traits.name: Minor Conjuration
traits.description:
You can use your action to conjure up an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet.

The object disappears after 1 hour, when you use this feature again, or if it takes or deals any damage.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Guidance cantrip.

traits.name: Clear Divination
traits.description:
When you cast a divination spell of 1st-level or higher, you can roll a d20 and record the number rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with this foretelling roll. You can choose to do so after you know the roll, but before you know if the roll succeeded or failed. If you finish a long rest without expending your foretelling roll, you lose it.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Friends cantrip.

traits.name: Convincing Enchantment
traits.description: When the effects of an enchantment spell you cast end on a creature, instead of knowing that you enchanted them instantly, they must succeed on a saving throw against the spell to gain that knowledge.  If the spell doesn't normally involve a saving throw, they make a Wisdom saving throw.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn an evocation cantrip of your choice.

traits.name: Potent Evocation
traits.description: When an evocation cantrip you cast requires its target(s) to make a saving throw, creatures take half damage on a successful save, but do not suffer any additional effects, other than damage, imposed by the cantrip.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Minor Illusion cantrip.  You can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of Minor Illusion.

traits.name: Subtle Illusions
traits.description: You can cast illusion spells without providing verbal components.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Chill Touch cantrip.

traits.name: Corrupting Necromancy
traits.description: When you deal damage to a creature with a necromancy spell, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn by means of lesser than or equal power to the triggering spell.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Pacify cantrip.

traits.name: Soothing Restoration
traits.description: When you cast a restoration spell that restores hit points, you can roll any dice you roll as part of the spell twice, and take the higher result.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Blood Siphon cantrip.

traits.name: Bloody Sangromancy
traits.description: When you cast a sangromancy spell that requires you to roll hit dice, you can roll them twice and take either total.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Prestidigitation cantrip.

traits.name: Minor Transmutation
traits.description:
You can temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance into another. You perform a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone (but not a gemstone), iron, copper, or silver, transforming it into a different one of those materials.

For each 10 minutes you spend performing the procedure, you can transform up to 1 cubic foot of material. After 1 hour, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell), the material reverts to its original substance.

traits.name: Bonus Cantrip
traits.description: You learn the Mage Hand cantrip. The spectral hand is invisible when you cast it.

traits.name: Distant Transposition
traits.description: The range of your transposition spells, and the distance they can move targets, doubles. If a spell has a range of Touch, it gains a range of 30 feet.

name: Aberrant Dragonmark
description:
You have manifested an aberrant dragonmark. Determine its appearance and the flaw associated with it. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn a cantrip of your choice from the Arcane spell list. In addition, choose a 1st-level spell from the Arcane spell list. You learn that spell and can cast it through your mark. Once you cast it, you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it again through the mark. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
  • When you cast the 1st-level spell through your mark, you can expend one of your Hit Dice and roll it. If you roll an even number, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the number rolled. If you roll an odd number, one random creature within 30 feet of you (not including you) takes force damage equal to the number rolled. If no other creatures are in range, you take the damage.

name: Acrobat
description:
You become more nimble, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Acrobatics skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have resistance to fall damage.

name: Actor
description:
Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have an advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Performance) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.
  • You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

name: Alert
description:
Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:
  • You can't be surprised while you are conscious.
  • You gain a +5 bonus to initiative.
  • Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

name: Animal Handler
description:
You master the techniques needed to train and handle animals. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan. If you speak in Sylvan, you can communicate simple ideas with beasts.

name: Arcanist
description:
You study the arcane arts, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • When you search for traps, you can locate magical traps as if they were mundane.
  • You learn to speak, read, and write Draconic, Jiganti, or Primordial.

name: Athlete
description:
You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain a climbing and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
  • You gain proficiency in the Athletics or Acrobatics skill.

name: Weapon Master
description:
You have taken the time to master a specific class of melee weapon. Choose a class of melee weapon from Axes, Bows, Brawling, Clubs, Crossbows, Flails, Hammers, Pickaxes, Polearms, Shortblades, Spears, or Swords. You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with your chosen class of weapons, and you gain additional benefits determined by your choice. All Spears are also considered Polearms, but you do not gain the bonus to attack rolls twice if you choose this feat multiple times.

You can take this feat multiple times, and must choose a different class of melee weapon each time.

traits.name: Headsman
traits.description: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an axe, you can choose to cleave their head from their body, killing them instantly.  You cannot do so against a creature without a head or one that can survive without their head.

traits.name: Shieldbreaker
traits.description: When you hit a creature wielding a nonmagical shield with an opportunity attack using an axe, you can cleave through their shield, reducing the bonus it grants to their Armor Class by 1.  If this reduces the shield's bonus to 0, it is destroyed.  Damage caused by this feature can be repaired over the course of a long rest, provided the shield wasn't completely destroyed.

traits.name: Hamstring Shot
traits.description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a bow, you can force them to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier).  On a failed saving throw, they fall prone and can't stand up until the start of your next turn.

traits.name: Scatter Shot
traits.description: As an action, you can load multiple arrows onto a bow string, allowing you to make one ranged attack against all creatures within 5 feet of a point within the bow's normal range.

traits.name: Iron Grip
traits.description: When you are wielding a brawling weapon, you can attempt to grapple or shove a creature in place of an attack of opportunity.

traits.name: Throat Chop
traits.description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a brawling weapon, you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier).  On a failed saving throw, they can't speak or cast spells with verbal components until the end of your next turn.

traits.name: Bonebreaker
traits.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can wind up for a swing with a club.  Your next attack with a club deals an additional die of damage.

traits.name: Concussion
traits.description: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack using a club, you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier).  On a failed saving throw, the target is dazed until the end of its next turn.  While dazed, the creature's speed is halved and it cannot take reactions.  A creature immune to being stunned is immune to being dazed.

traits.name: Bow and Blade
traits.description: When you use the Attack action and attack with a one handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a hand crossbow you are holding.

traits.name: Point Blank
traits.description: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

traits.name: Quick Load
traits.description: You ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.

traits.name: Brutal Guardian
traits.description: When you hit with an opportunity attack using a flail, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Winding Strike
traits.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can prepare yourself to extend your flail to sweep over targets' shields. Until the end of this turn, your attack rolls with a flail gain a +2 bonus against any target using a shield.

traits.name: Crush
traits.description: You deal double damage to objects and structures with attacks made with a hammer.

traits.name: Kneebreaker
traits.description: When you hit with an opportunity attack using a hammer, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

traits.name: Armor Breaker
traits.description: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack using a pickaxe, you can remove one damage resistance of your choice until the end of your next turn.

traits.name: Hooked Grapple
traits.description: When you are wielding a pickaxe, you can attempt to grapple a creature in place of an attack of opportunity.  You can grapple a creature using a pickaxe, and a creature grappled in such a way takes piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of your turns.

traits.name: Haft Strike
traits.description: When you take the Attack action and attack with only a polearm, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary attack. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d4, and it deals bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Vigilant Pikeman
traits.description: While you are wielding a polearm, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter the reach you have with that weapon.

traits.name: Blade Dance
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can assume an acrobatic stance, provided you have a shortblade in hand. Doing so grants advantage on Dexterity saving throws until the start of your next turn or until you're not holding a shortblade.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.description: When you make an opportunity attack with a shortblade against a creature wielding a weapon, you can force them to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier).  On a failed saving throw, the target drops one weapon of your choice, and it flies away 5 feet in a random direction.

traits.name: Long Reach
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can increase your reach with a spear you're holding by 5 feet until the start of your next turn.

traits.name: Surgebreaker
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can set your spear to receive a charge. If a creature moves within your spear's reach on its next turn, you can make a melee attack against it with your spear as a reaction. If the attack hits, the target takes an extra die of damage.

traits.name: Deft Defender
traits.description: When you make an opportunity attack with a sword, you have advantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Parrying Stance
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can assume a parrying stance, provided you have a sword in hand. Doing so grants a +1 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn or until you're not holding a sword.

name: Brawny
description:
You become stronger, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You count as if you were one size larger for the purpose of determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift, as well as when determining the size of creatures you can grapple, shove, or disarm.

name: Cannonmaster
description:
You are a sight to behold on the battlefield, unleashing volley after volley with unprecedented speed. A strong fighter, you are drawn to the most powerful weapons available to you, packing the hardest punch with each shot. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When using siege equipment such as cannons, ballista, trebuchet, or other similar weapons that require multiple actions to aim and fire, you may aim and fire them using one action. Additionally, you can use your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls made with these weapons.
  • When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack made with a ranged weapon that uses your Strength modifier, you may roll an additional damage die.

name: Cover Fighter
description:
Experienced in the art of a firefight, you know how to avoid enemy fire while returning fire of your with deadly precision. Whether from a low wall, a tree trunk, a small trench, or the window of a building, you know how to keep your head down and keep calm amongst the hail of bullets. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Cover increases your Armor Class by an additional 1.
  • While in half or three-quarters cover, you may add a +1 or +2, respectively, to a ranged weapon attack roll made against a creature, so long as your cover is in between yourself and that creature.

name: Defensive Duelist
description: When you are wielding a finesse weapon with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

name: Devious Scoundrel
description:
You have a devious mind that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Devious Exploits of your choice from among those available to the rogue class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Diplomat
description:
You master the arts of diplomacy, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient in this skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You learn to speak, read, and write three additional languages.

name: Dual Wielder
description:
You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:
  • You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
  • You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one handed melee weapons you are wielding aren't light.
  • You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

name: Dungeon Delver
description:
Alert to the hidden traps and secret doors found in many dungeons, you gain the following benefits:
  • You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
  • You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
  • You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
  • Travelling at a fast pace doesn't impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Wisdom (Perception) score.

name: Durable
description:
Hardy and resilient, you gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).
  • Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.

name: Eldritch Adept
description: Studying occult lore, you have unlocked eldritch power within yourself: you learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the warlock class, assuming you meet its prerequisites.Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.

name: Elemental Adept
description:
When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

name: Insightful
description:
You possess keen insight into how other people think and feel. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Insight skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can take the Help action as a bonus action.

name: Exotic Weapon Training
description:
You have trained with specialized weapons, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with two exotic weapons of your choice.

name: Fell Handed
description:
You master large weapons. You gain the following benefits when using a melee weapon with the Massive property:
  • You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with the weapon.
  • Whenever you have advantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon and hit, you can also knock the target prone if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target.
  • Whenever you have disadvantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two d20 rolls would have hit.
  • If you use the Help action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding the weapon, you knock the target's shield aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the ally gains a +2 bonus to the roll if the target is using a shield

name: Plane-Touched
description:
You have been exposed to the innate magic of one of the planes. Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Additionally, choose one of the following planes. You can take this feat multiple times, and must choose a different plane each time.

traits.name: Astral-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Star Dust spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Divination or Evocation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Wind-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Gust of Wind spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Evocation or Transposition school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Stone-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Earth Ripple spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Evocation or Transmutation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Flame-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Scorching Ray spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Evocation or Illusion school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Wave-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Dancing Wave spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Evocation or Restoration school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Fey-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Misty Step spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Enchantment or Illusion school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Chaos-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Elemental Anguish spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Evocation or Transmutation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Dark-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Darkness spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Enchantment or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Law-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Zone of Truth spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Abjuration or Divination school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Null-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Warding Bond spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Abjuration or Transposition school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Shadow-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Invisibility spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

traits.name: Light-Touched
traits.description: You learn the Radiant Barrage spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Evocation or Restoration school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

name: Fighting Initiate
description:
Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the Fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's fighting style with another one from the fighter class that you don't have.

name: Frontliner
description:
Owing to your brawn, bravery, or otherwise, you prefer to fight up close and personal, charging headlong into battle. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attacks.
  • When you make a ranged weapon attack against a creature and hit, you may use your bonus action to make a melee attack.

name: Gift of the Chromatic Dragon
description:
You've manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits:
  • As a bonus action, you can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
  • When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Gift of the Gem Dragon
description:
You've manifested some of the power of gem dragons, granting you the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
description:
You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:
  • You learn the Cure Wounds spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have. The spell's spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma when you cast it with this feat (choose when you gain the feat).
  • You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Grappler
description:
You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:
  • You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.
  • A creature you are grappling has disadvantage on attack rolls against any creature other than you.
  • You can use your action to try to pin a creature grappled by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, the creature is restrained until the grapple ends. You can only have one creature pinned at a time.

name: Gunner
description:
You have a quick hand and keen eye when employing firearms, granting you the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with firearms.
  • Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
  • You can reload firearms using your Use an Object interaction rather than their normal reloading time.

name: Gunslinger
description:
Known for having the fastest hands in the West, East, North, South, or anywhere in between. Your lighting reflexes drop foes in a flurry of gunpowder before they even know what hit them. You gain the following benefits:
  • You may add your proficiency bonus to your initiative, or again if you already do so.
  • As part of your weapon attacks, you may draw the weapon if it is stowed.
  • You have advantage on ability checks to notice concealed weapons on another creature.
  • You may use your reaction to make a weapon attack against another creature that has not yet taken its turn in combat. This attack is at disadvantage unless you succeed on a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check contested by the target's Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. If the attack is a ranged weapon attack, it cannot exceed the weapon's normal range.

name: Heavily Armored
description:
You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with heavy armor.
  • The time it takes for you to don or doff heavy armor is reduced to 1 minute.

name: Heavy Armor Master
description:
You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • While you are wearing heavy armor, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical attacks is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

name: Historian
description:
Your study of history rewards you with the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the History skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you spend 1 minute examining an object you are touching, you can ascertain its value, origin, and age.

name: Inspiring Leader
description: You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest.

name: Investigator
description:
You have an eye for detail and can pick out the smallest clues. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Investigation skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can take the Search action as a bonus action.

name: Jury-Rigger
description:
Guns can be fickle. They jam, break, and sometimes are plain out to get you. You've seen it all, and know how to whip your firearm back into shape at a moment's notice. You gain the following benefits.
  • Increase your Strength or Intelligence by 1, to a maximum of 20
  • When using a firearm with a misfire die of d4 or lower, treat it as a d6. Additionally, when rolling the misfire die before an attack roll with a jammed firearm, you may use your bonus action to reroll it.
  • You may swap attachments on your firearm over the course of 1 minute with a successful Tinker's Tools check. You may also modify your firearm's main parts in half the time, to a minimum of a short rest.

name: Keen Mind
description:
You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits.
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You always know which way is north.
  • You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
  • You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.
  • You gain proficiency in your choice of the Arcana, History, Nature, Religion, Society, or Technology skills.

name: Lightly Armored
description:
You have trained to master the use of light armor, gaining the following benefits.
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with light armor.
  • If your Dexterity modifier is negative, it is not applied to your Armor Class while wearing light armor.

name: Linguist
description:
You have studied languages and codes, gaining the following benefits:
  • You can understand any spoken language.
  • You can ably create written ciphers. Others can't decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it.

name: Lucky
description:
You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment.

You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20 and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or yours.

If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.

You regain your expended luck points when you finish a long rest.

name: Mage Slayer
description:
You have practiced techniques in melee combat against spellcasters, gaining the following benefits.
  • When a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature before they cast the spell. If that attack hits, the target creature must make a Constitution saving throw in order to successfully cast the spell. The DC equals 10 or half of the damage the creature takes from the attack, whichever is higher. If the creature fails its saving throw, the spell fails and has no effect. If the creature succeeds on its saving throw, the spell is cast as normal.
  • When you damage a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its concentration.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of you.

name: Magic Initiate
description:
Choose a spell list: Arcane, Divine, Melodic, Occult, Primal, or Psionic. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that spell list.

In addition, choose one 1st-level spell to learn from that same list. Using this feat, you can cast the spell once at its lowest level, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again.

Your spellcasting ability for all three spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice).

traits.description: You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell from the Arcane spell list.
You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell from the Divine spell list.
You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell from the Melodic spell list.
You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell from the Occult spell list.
You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell from the Primal spell list.
You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell from the Psionic spell list.

name: Martial Adept
description:
You have martial training that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Martial Exploits of your choice from among those available to the fighter class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Medic
description:
You master the physician's arts, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Medicine skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • Creatures you take a long rest with can roll each of their hit dice twice, and take the higher result.

name: Medium Armor Master
description:
You have practiced moving in medium armor to gain the following benefits:
  • Wearing medium armor doesn't impose disadvantage on your Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
  • When you wear medium armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

name: Menacing
description:
You become fearsome to others, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. If you are already proficiency in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You cannot have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures frightened of you.

name: Metamagic Adept
description:
You've learned how to exert your will on your spells to alter how they function:
  • You learn two Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless the option says otherwise. Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of these Metamagic options with another one from the sorcerer class.
  • You gain 2 sorcery points to spend on Metamagic (these points are added to any sorcery points you have from another source but can be used only on Metamagic). You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

name: Mighty Summons
description:
You have mastered summoning minions to fight for you, and your magic leaks over into their abilities. Creatures you summon by casting spells gain the following benefits:
  • Their attacks are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical damage.
  • They gain temporary hit points equal to your level when you summon them.

name: Mobile
description:
You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits:
  • Your speed increases by 10 feet.
  • When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn.
  • When you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

name: Moderately Armored
description:
You have trained to master the use of medium armor, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with medium armor.
  • The time it takes for you to don medium armor is reduced to 1 minute.

name: Martial Training
description:
You have trained with all manner of martial weaponry, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with all martial weapons.

name: Mounted Combatant
description:
You are a dangerous foe to face while mounted. While you are mounted and aren't incapacitated, you gain the following benefits:
  • You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount.
  • You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.
  • If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

name: Mud Lover, Ground Hitter
description:
You are very accustomed to being shot at and to hitting the deck in an emergency. Unfortunately for you, cover is always a bit too far away. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When you are targeted by a ranged weapon attack, you may use your reaction to drop prone.
  • Being prone does not impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attacks.
  • While prone, your speed increases by 10 feet.

name: Naturalist
description:
Your extensive study of nature rewards you with the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Nature skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • Your movement is not impeded by nonmagical difficult terrain of the natural world such as brambles, mud, or ice.

name: Observant
description:
Quick to notice details of your environment, you gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips.
  • You have a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) and passive Intelligence (Investigation) scores.

name: Outlaw
description:
Nothing beats the smell of gunpowder in the moments after blasting away a foe. You gain the following benefits:
  • When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you may take the Reload action as a Bonus Action until the end of your turn.
  • When when you score a critical hit with a firearm, you may automatically reload up to 2 rounds, consuming ammo as normal.
  • As an action, you can make as many attacks as ammunition left in the magazine of a one-handed cylinder-action firearm that you are proficient with. These attacks are always at disadvantage and cannot exceed the firearm's normal range.
  • Lever-Action firearms that are light are considered to be one-handed for you.

name: Perceptive
description:
You hone your senses until they become razor sharp. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Perception skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • Being in a lightly obscured area doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom (Perception) checks if you can both see and hear.

name: Performer
description:
You master performance so that you can command any stage. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Performance skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You gain proficiency with two instruments of your choice.

name: Pistolero
description:
You've honed your skill of aiming two weapons at the same time. You gain the following benefits:
  • When you take the Attack action and attack with a ranged weapon that you're holding in one hand, you can use a bonus action to attack with a different ranged weapon that you're holding in the other hand. You may add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack.
  • You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.
  • You can take the Reload action to reload two light, one-handed firearms in each of your hands at once.

name: Quick-Fingered
description:
Your nimble fingers and agility let you perform sleight of hand. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Sleight of Hand skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can take the Use an Object action as a bonus action.

name: Quipping Expertise
description:
Your quick tongue allows you to remark at any failure your enemies make, reducing their resolve to fight. You gain the following benefits:
  • You learn the Vicious Mockery cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.
  • When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails an ability check or saving throw, or misses with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to cast Vicious Mockery targeting them.

name: Resilient
description:
Choose one ability score. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in saving throws using the chosen ability.

name: Revenant Warrior
description:
You have trained extensively with double weapons. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with one weapon of your choice that has the Double property.
  • While wielding weapon with the Double property with two hands, you gain +1 AC.

name: Ritual Caster
description:
You have learned a number of spells that you can cast as rituals. These spells are written in a ritual book, which you must have in hand while casting one of them.

When you choose this feat, you acquire a ritual book holding two 1st-level spells of your choice. Choose one of the following spell lists: Arcane, Divine, Melodic, Occult, Primal, or Psionic. You must choose your spells from that spell list, and the spells you choose must have the ritual tag. Your spellcasting ability for these rituals is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice).

If you come across a spell in written form, such as a magical spell scroll or a wizard's spellbook, you might be able to add it to your ritual book. The spell must be on the spell list you chose, the spell's level can be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents the material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.

name: Savage Warrior
description:
You fight with a primal ferocity that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Savage Exploits of your choice from among those available to the barbarian class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Sentinel
description:
You have mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard, gaining the following benefits.
  • When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.
  • Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.
  • When a creature makes an attack against a target other than you (and that target doesn't have this feat), you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

name: Shield Master
description:
You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a shield:
  • If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
  • If you aren't incapacitated, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect.
  • If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

name: Shield Training
description:
You've trained in the effective use of shields. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with shields.
  • In combat, you can don or doff a shield as the free object interaction on your turn.
  • If can cast spells, you can use a shield as a spellcasting focus.

name: Silver-Tongued
description:
You develop your conversational skill to better deceive others. You gain the following benefits.
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Deception skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can lie to creatures that always know when they hear a lie (such as a solar). Such creatures have advantage on Insight checks made to determine if you are lying.

name: Skill Expert
description:
You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, granting you the following benefits:
  • Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
  • Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

name: Skilled
description: You gain proficiency in any combination of three skills or tools of your choice.

name: Skulker
description:
You are an expert at slinking through shadows. You gain the following benefits:
  • You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.
  • When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.
  • Dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight.

name: Spell Sniper
description:
You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:
  • When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled.
  • Your ranged spell attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
  • You learn one cantrip that requires an attack roll. Choose the cantrip from any spell list. Your spellcasting ability for the cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice).

name: Stealthy
description:
You know how best to hide. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you are hidden, you can move up to 10 feet in the open without revealing yourself if you end the move in a position where you're not clearly visible.

name: Supreme Power
description:
You have discovered an immense source of power within yourself: you learn one Astounding Power of your choice from the empowered class, assuming you meet its prerequisites.

Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the power with another one from the empowered class.

name: Scholarly Bearing
description:
You have studied a particular field to an extreme: you learn one Scholarly Pursuit of your choice from the savant class, assuming you meet its prerequisites.

Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the pursuit with another one from the savant class.

name: Wilderness Wanderer
description:
You have spent a large amount of time in the wild: you learn one Survivalist Knack of your choice from the nomad or ranger class, assuming you meet its prerequisites.

Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the pursuit with another one from the nomad or ranger class.

name: Wild Companion
description:
You have forged a bond with an animal companion that will adventure by your side. Choose a beast of CR 1/8 or lower to be your Wild Companion. This Companion is friendly to you, and it obeys your commands to the best of its abilities.

Your Companion uses its normal stat block, but it learns to understand one language of your choice that you speak. You and your Companion can communicate simple ideas to each other using a series of clicks, whistles, and gestures. It gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

In combat, your Wild Companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it will only take the Dodge action on its turn unless you use a bonus action to command it to take an action from its stat block or another action. If you are incapacitated, your Companion will defend itself to the best of its ability. If you die, your Companion will do everything in its power to flee and return to its home.

If your Companion dies, you can spend 8 hours tracking and training a new Wild Companion, but only if a suitable beast of CR 1/8 or lower can be found in your local area within an 8-hour period.

name: Survivalist
description:
You master wilderness lore, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Survival skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You cannot become lost by nonmagical means.

name: Tactician
description:
You have a tactical sixth sense that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Tactical Exploits of your choice from among those available to the warlord class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice).
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Tandem Tactician
description:
Your presence in a scrap tends to elevate your comrades. You gain the following benefits:
  • You can use the Help action as a bonus action.
  • When you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, increase the range of the Help action by 10 feet. Additionally, you can help two allies targeting the same creature within range when you use the Help action this way.

name: Tavern Brawler
description:
Accustomed to the rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, you gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Consititution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You are proficient with improvised weapons.
  • You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes or improvised weapons.
  • You can grapple a creature as a bonus action.

name: Telekinetic
description:
You learn to move things with your mind, granting you the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn the Mage Hand cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand invisible. If you already know this spell, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it. Its spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
  • As a bonus action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat) or be moved 5 feet toward or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

name: Telepathic
description:
You awaken the ability to mentally connect with others, granting you the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.
  • You can cast the Detect Thoughts spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

name: Theologian
description:
Your extensive study of religion rewards you with the following benefits.
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Religion skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You always know if you are in an area that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.
  • You learn to speak, read, and write Abyssal, Carcerin, Celestial, or Infernal.

name: Defiant Will
description:
Your will is endless and your constitution is impeccable.. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Defiant Exploits of your choice from among those available to the juggernaut class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: War Caster
description:
You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:
  • You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.
  • You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.
  • When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

name: Mountain Mover
description:
Your strength rivals the giants that roam your homeland. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
  • As an action, you can pick up a large boulder or rip a chunk of natural stone out of the ground and make the attack with it. The boulder is a simple melee weapon with the thrown property. It has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to 2d6 + your Strength modifier. A creature struck by this boulder must make a Strength saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked prone. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Strong Wings
description:
Your flying is strong and powerful compared to other aarakocra allowing you to carry more weight during flight.
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can now fly while wearing medium armor.

name: Magical Devourer
description:
Your stomach is so strong that you can even devour magic itself. As an action, you can choose one object or magical effect within a range of 10 feet of you. Any spell of a level lower than or equal to one third your level (minimum 1) on the target is dispelled. For each spell of a level higher than that, make an ability check with your Constitution score. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell is dispelled. Regardless of success, you then regain hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1). Effects that refer to the Dispel Magic spell also apply to this feature, such as wall of force.

You can use this feature once, and must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

name: Angelic Protection
description: The innate resistance to magic that angels possess extends to you. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

name: Impish Curse
description:
You learn to wield a devilish curse. Choose one the following curses. As an action, you can touch a creature within 5 feet of you and force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, the target becomes cursed, and suffers the effects of your impish curse. You must concentrate on this curse, as if concentrating on a spell.

You can use your impish curse once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

traits.description: The cursed creature has advantage on melee attacks that target the last creature to deal damage to it, and disadvantage on all other attacks.
The cursed creature treats each creature further than 10 feet away from it that has not taken a hostile action against it in the last minute as friendly.
When the cursed creature misses with an attack, it becomes dazed until the end of its next turn, or until it takes any damage.
Whenever the cursed creature fails a saving throw against being frightened, it takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

Whenever the cursed creature is missed with an attack, it is overcome with laughter, suffering one of the following effects:
  • The target loses its reaction.
  • If the target cannot lose its reaction, it falls prone.
  • If the target is prone and cannot lose its reaction, it begins choking until the end of its next turn.
Whenever the cursed creature takes damage, it takes 1d4 additional damage of the same type.
The cursed creature emits foul vapors in a 5 foot radius. Each creature that starts their turn in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

name: Melding Spores
description:
Your spores increase in strength, granting you the ability to truly meld with nearby creatures. When you use your Rapport Spores trait, you can force any the affected creatures to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus). A creature can willingly fail this saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature is charmed by you and all of the other creatures affected by your spores for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, the creature feels intense pacifistic instincts, and avoids all harmful actions, direct and indirect. An affected creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Heavenly Rebirth
description:
When you are reduced 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to regain a number of hit points equal to your level, and immediately activate your transformation trait (if available), as listed below.
SubraceTrait
BalanceCosmic Shape
ChainwroughtLawbringer
FallenNecrotic Shroud
MessengerHerald's Voice
PrimalSacred Beast
PrimordialElemental Form
ProphetSeer's Eyes
ProtectorRadiant Soul
RazorwingBladed Warlord
ScourgeRadiant Consumption
ShimmerPsionic Beauty
TitanDivine Dynamo
TwilightBeloved Pariah
Avernese - ZarielHellish Consumption
You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Dominating Gaze
description: Your gaze grows more powerful, forcing those affected by it to obey you.  While a creature is under the effects of your Mindsap Gaze, you can use a bonus action give the target a one-word command, which they must follow on their next turn.  After the end of their next turn, they are no longer charmed by you.

name: Well-Rested
description:
Your practiced napping leaves you invigorated when you are awake. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Whenever you spend one or more hit dice during a short rest, you can regain an extra 1d6 hit points.
  • When you fail an ability check or saving throw, you can choose to reroll it and take the higher roll. You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Adaptive Shapechange
description: Your shapechanging abilities are particularly refined, and allow you to adapt to your environment. You can cast the Alter Self spell at will. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

name: Draconic Ferocity
description:
You take on the ferocious presence of dragons. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength, Constitution, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Instead of exhaling destructive energy, you can expend a use of your Breath Weapon trait to roar, forcing each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes frightened for 1 minute. If the frightened target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
  • You gain an additional natural weapon of your choice from your claws, fangs, horns, or tail.

traits.description: Your claws are a natural weapon which you can use to make unarmed strikes.  They deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit, and you can use your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with them.

Your fangs are a natural weapon which you can use to make unarmed strikes. They deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier on a hit.

If you are a Savage dragonborn, the damage of your Elemental Jaws trait additionally increases to 1d8.

Your horns are a natural weapon which you can use to make unarmed strikes.  They deal bludgeoning or piercing damage (your choice) equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line during your turn, you gain advantage on the first attack you make with your horns.
Your tail is a natural weapon which you can use to make unarmed strikes.  It deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and it has a reach of 10 feet.

name: Dwarven Fortitude
description:
You have the blood of dwarf heroes flowing through your veins. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Whenever you take the Dodge action in combat, you can spend one Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total (minimum of 1).

name: Elven Accuracy
description:
The accuracy of elves is legendary, especially that of elf archers and spellcasters. You have uncanny aim with attacks that rely on precision rather than brute force. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20
  • Whenever you have advantage on an attack roll using Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you roll three dice, rather than two, and take the highest result.

name: Quickling Blood
description: You have traces of quickling blood in your veins, allowing you to make your position imprecise. You can cast the Blur spell. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it. You can cast it in this way once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Pixie Blood
description: You have traces of pixie blood in your veins, allowing you to make yourself invisible. You can cast the Invisibility spell on yourself. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it. You can cast it in this way once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Sprite Blood
description: You have traces of sprite blood in your veins, allowing you to determine the attitudes of others. As an action, you can touch a creature and force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed saving throw, you learn the target's alignment and its bonds, ideals, and flaws.  You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

name: Beast Magic
description: Your connection to animals deepens. You learn the Speak with Animals spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Animal Friendship and Beast Sense spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Compound Legacy
description: Your draconic legacy draws upon multiple species of dragons.  Choose an additional Draconic Legacy option.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

traits.name: Forceful Presence
traits.description: When you make a Intimidation or Persuasion check, you can do so with advantage once per short or long rest.

traits.name: Chromatic Infusion
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can touch a weapon and infuse it with your breath weapon. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the same damage type as your breath weapon when it hits. After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

actions.name: Chromatic Infusion
actions.description: You can touch a weapon and infuse it with your breath weapon. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 {breath-damage} damage when it hits.

traits.name: Psionic Mind
traits.description:
You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

In addition, you learn the Mage Hand cantrip, and the spectral hand is invisible when you cast it.

traits.name: Metallic Breath Weapon
traits.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. The specific nature of your Metallic Breath Weapon is determined by your subrace.  Once you use your Metallic Breath Weapon, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Sleep Breath
traits.description: Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become unconscious until the start of your next turn or until they take any damage or a creature within 5 feet of them uses an action to shake or slap them awake.

traits.name: Antithetical Breath
traits.description:
Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take force damage in an amount determined by how different their alignment is from your own. the target takes 1d10 force damage if its moral identity (good, neutral, or evil) differs from your own. Additionally, if the target's ideals towards society and order (lawful, neutral, or chaotic) also differ from your own, it takes an additional 1d10 force damage. If the target shares your alignment, the breath has no effect. This breath does not reveal a creature's alignment to you.

Both instances of damage increase by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

traits.name: Bite
traits.description: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Elemental Jaws
traits.description: When you deal damage with your Bite attack, you can choose to deal an additional 1d6 damage of the same type as your breath weapon. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Touch of Umberlee
description: Your connection to the sea deepens. You learn the Create or Destroy Water spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Fog Cloud and Howling Downpour spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Nobanion
description: Your lineage traces back to the god of lions, Lord Firemane himself. You learn the Heroism spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Beacon of Valor and Track spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot.
