You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Kurtulmak
description: You have been blessed with draconic magic by Kurtulmak, god of the kobolds. You learn the Feather Fall spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Absorb Elements and Dragon's Breath spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Pan
description: You feel the revelrous, musical nature of Pan, god of satyrs. You learn the Heroism spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Dissonant Whispers and Song of Confidence spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Ilsensine
description: Your connection to the God-Brain is stronger than most. You learn the Detect Magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Charm Person and Levitate spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Vlaakith
description: You are the chosen of the lich-queen Vlaakith. You learn the Detect Magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Command and Hold Person spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Limbo
description: Your time spent in Limbo has modified your psionics, increasing their potency. You learn the Detect Magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Magnify Gravity and Calm Emotions spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Baba Yaga
description: Your latent hag blood has awakened a connection to the mother of all witches. You learn the Practitioner's Rites spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Charm Person and Desecration spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Anubis
description: Your connection to Anubis, patron deity of the khenra, deepens. You learn the False Life spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Heart Sunder and Hold Person spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Juiblex
description: You feel the touch of Juiblex, the primordial demon lord that created all oozes long ago. You learn the Grease spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Caustic Coating and Melf's Acid Arrow spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of the Raven
description: You have been blessed by the Raven Queen for her own mysterious purposes. You learn the Murmurs of the Restless spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Dread Will and Shadow Blade spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Nyx
description: You have been touched by the goddess of night and harpies, Nyx. You learn the Bane spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Grimlore's Shadowblight and Darkness spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Lolth
description: You have been touched by the goddess of drow and of spiders, Lolth. You learn the Creeping Touch spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Envenomed Touch and Spider Climb spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Touch of Silvanus
description: You have been touched by the god of wood elves, Silvanus. You learn the Animal Friendship spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Longstrider and Pass Without Trace spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Antimagic Hide
description: Your hide is resistant to magic. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

name: Fade Away
description:
Your people are clever, with a knack for illusion magic. You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Immediately after you take damage, you can use a reaction to magically become invisible until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Like a Boss
description:
You are accustomed to using others to avoid being attacked. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When a creature you can see targets you with an attack and another creature is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Poisonous Skin
description:
Once per turn if you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, they must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed saving throw, the target takes 2d4 poison damage.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Everybody's Friend
description:
You develop your magnetic personality to ease your way through the world. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in Deception and Persuasion skills. If you're already proficient in either skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with that skill.

name: Orcish Aggression
description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

name: Touch of Yeenoghu
description:
You have been touched by the magic of Yeenoghu, master of all gnolls. Once per turn when you hit with a melee attack, you can force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed saving throw, the target suffers one of the following additional effects of your choice:
  • The attack deals extra psychic damage equal to your level.
  • The target is paralyzed until the start of your next turn.
  • The target is under the effects of the Confusion spell until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Orcish Fury
description:
Your fury burns tirelessly. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
  • When you hit with a weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon's damage type. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
  • Immediately after you use your Relentless Endurance trait, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack.

name: Bountiful Luck
description:
Your people have extraordinary luck, which you have learned to mystically lend to your companions whenever you see them falter. You're not sure how you do it, you just wish it, and it happens. Surely a sign of fortune's favor!
  • When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you rolls a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to let the ally reroll the die. The ally must use the new roll.
  • When you use this ability, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn

name: Uphold the Legion
description:
You were born for life in the legion. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn two Tactical Exploits of your choice from among those available to the warlord class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice).
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.

name: Prodigy
description:
You are filled with a determination that can draw the unreachable within your reach. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one tool proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.
  • Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.
If you are a half-blooded race, you can only choose this feat if your other parent is a human.

name: Human Determination
description:
You are filled with a determination that can draw the unreachable within your reach. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When you fail an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can choose to reroll it and take the higher of the two rolls. You can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
If you are a half-blooded race, you can only choose this feat if your other parent is a human.

name: Dao Heritage
description:
Your heritage includes a dao, genie of the earth. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn the detect magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot.
  • You gain tremorsense out to 30 feet.

name: Djinni Heritage
description:
Your heritage includes a djinni, genie of the air. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn the detect magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot.
  • Nonmagical ranged attacks against you from more than 30 feet away are made at disadvantage.

name: Efreeti Heritage
description:
Your heritage includes an efreeti, genie of fire. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn the detect magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot.
  • When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal 1d4 fire damage to the creature.

name: Marid Heritage
description:
Your heritage includes a marid, genie of water. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn the detect magic spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot.
  • You can move into a hostile creature's space regardless of its size, and you can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

name: Kalashtar Psionics
description: You know the Mage Hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Silvery Barbs spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Mind Spike spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

name: Master of Mimicry
description:
You have learned to temporarily mimic even the training of others. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity, Intelligence, or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Whenever another creature you can see uses a skill or tool, you can use your reaction to gain proficiency in that skill or tool. Proficiencies gained in this way last for 1 hour, and you can only mimic one proficiency at a time. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Touch of Sess'inek
description:
You manifest the demonic bearing of a lizard king or queen. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You learn to speak, read, and write Abyssal.
  • You are immune to being frightened.

name: Orcish Strength
description:
You are big, even for an orc. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift double.
  • You have advantage on checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.
  • You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill if you don't already have it, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for checks made with it.

name: Tanarukk Blood
description:
Through fell magic or an ancestor, you are touched by the corruptive power of Baphomet. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have resistance to fire and poison damage.
  • You gain a bite attack as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

name: Ghour Blood
description:
Through fell magic or an ancestor, you are touched by the corruptive power of Baphomet. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have resistance to fire and poison damage.
  • You gain a bite attack as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

name: Chilling Gaze
description:
Your gaze can freeze creatures in place, using the icy magic of the tundra. As an action, you can fix your gaze on a creature within 40 feet of you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus).

On a failed save, the target takes cold damage equal to your level and gains an equal number of temporary hit points as a crust of ice crawls over it. While a creature has any of these temporary hit points, it is restrained. A creature freed from this effect by bludgeoning damage immediately takes slashing damage equal to your level.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Improved Regeneration
description: Your regeneration is more powerful, and can even keep you alive when you would otherwise fall.  When you would make a death saving throw, you can instead use your Regeneration trait if possible.

name: Oni Magic
description: You learn to wield the magics of oni. You learn the Bloodsight spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Sleep and Invisibility spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Shell Defender
description:
You have mastered using your shell to better protect yourself and others. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Your natural armor trait now provides a base AC of 18. As normal, your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number.
  • As a reaction when you are forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, choose any number of creatures within 5 feet of you. Each chosen creature is considered to have half cover against any harmful attacks or effects while within 5 feet of you until the start of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you've finished a short or long rest.

name: Serpent Form
description:
You have unlocked more of your serpentfolk heritage. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can use an action to polymorph into a poisonous snake, constrictor snake, or giant poisonous snake, or back into your true form. Your statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If you die, you stay in your current form.

name: Improved Glide
description:
Your gliding membranes have improved, and you have learned to better use them to your advantage in combat. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can move up to 10 feet horizontally for each foot descended while gliding.
  • If you fall 10 feet or more and hit a creature with a melee attack, you can also knock them prone.

name: Breath Versatility
description:
You can alter your breath. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When you use your breath weapon, you can freely choose between using a line breath or a cone breath. If you choose a line, you can increase the width of your breath from 5 feet to 10 feet.

name: Misfit's Adaptation
description:
Your body continues to change in unexpected ways. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength, Constitution, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Choose one individual feature from a morph category available to the Embodiment of the Metamorph. You gain the chosen effect, which is permanent. If you already had access to morphs and have learned the associated morph category, you can choose whether to change this or your other Waning morph whenever you change morphs.
You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, choose a different morph.

options.name: Gold Luck
options.description: You harness the mystic fortuity of the gold dragon. Whenever you or an ally makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can choose to roll an additional d20. You can take this action after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so after finishing a short or long rest.

options.name: Sheltering Wings
options.description: Flexible armor plating grows across your wings, allowing you to use them as shelter for your allies. When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

options.name: Warrior's Will
options.description: You adorn your form with a symbol of bravery and prepare yourself to face opposition. You gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

options.name: Ivory Charge
options.description: Your horns split into a branching crown of antlers, capable of punching holes through hide and armor alike. You gain an antler natural weapon, which counts as a martial melee weapon for you. You can use it to make melee weapon attacks, with which you are proficient. Your antlers deal piercing damage equal to 3d4 + your Strength modifier. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line during your turn, you gain advantage on the first attack you make with your antlers.

options.name: Stone Scales
options.description: You assimilate available minerals in order to create a thick layer of defensive stone scales. Your Armor Class becomes equal to 16 + your Constitution modifier. You are considered as wearing heavy armor, but don't suffer penalties to your Dexterity (Stealth) or as a result of lacking heavy armor proficiency. You lose access to the Flight feature, as well as the speed benefit of Stride.

options.name: Capable Form
options.description: Your body grows better suited to grasping and manipulating objects. You can ignore the disadvantage imposed on attack on attack rolls by Mythic Build. Additionally, you gain proficiency with simple and martial weapons as well as with two tools of your choice.

options.name: Esoteric Ward
options.description: Runic glyphs carved across your body guard you against a variety of magics. You gain advantage on all Intelligence, Charisma, and Strength saving throws against magical effects.

options.name: Veiled Wings
options.description: Your wings expand, elegantly veiling you from your foes. Your Glide & Fly speed increases by 10 ft, and you can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

options.name: Reverberating Roar
options.description: Your voice grows deeper, seeming to come from a much larger creature. As a bonus action, you can roar, inciting fear and hesitation in your enemies. Each creature of your choice within 20 feet of you are forced to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC. A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to your roar until the end of your next turn.

options.name: Tunnel Wyrm
options.description: You gain a burrowing speed equal to half your walking speed. You can tunnel through loose dirt, gravel, and similar materials, but not through solid materials. If you burrow at half speed, you can reinforce your tunnel as you move, allowing others to pass through-otherwise your tunnel slowly collapses behind you. Additionally, as an action while burrowing near the surface, you can hollow out a portion of space in the terrain, which immediately collapses into a 15-feet wide and deep sinkhole. Creatures caught in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Dragon Spark DC or fall into the sinkhole and drop prone. On a succesful save, a creature can instead choose to move to the nearest available space without provoking opportunity attacks. If you spend 1 minute creating the sinkhole, it will instead collapse when the first creature that is Small or larger moves into its space. You can use this property twice, after which you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

options.name: Blasting Breath
options.description: Your elemental spark is always at the ready. You can use your action to exhale a bolt of elemental energy and spit it at a creature you can see within a range of 120. Make a ranged Dragon Spark attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 + your dragon spark ability score modifier damage. The damage is the same damage type as your Dragon's Breath. The number of damage dice increases by one at levels 5, 11, and 17.

options.name: Wyrm Tongue
options.description: Your suave voice is affable and soothing. You have gain proficiency in Deception or Persuasion (your choice). You can change your choice every time you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, you learn two languages of your choice.

options.name: Rending Jaws
options.description: Your jaw muscles grow more powerful, and your fangs grow serrated and cruel, capable of puncturing armor and rending flesh. When you hit with a bite attack, the target suffers a -1 to Armor Class for 1 minute. This effect can only be applied once per creature.

options.name: White Cunning
options.description: You instill yourself with the primal awareness of the white dragon. You have advantage on initiative checks and you ignore non-magical difficult terrain.

options.name: Driving Strikes
options.description: The tip of your tail develops a tough, bony club, and the force of your blows leaves your enemies reeling. When you make a tail attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal. Additionally, when you hit a target twice on the same turn with any combination of natural weapons, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be pushed 10 feet away from you.

options.name: Elemental Maw
options.description: Volatile energy fills your gullet. Once on each of your turns when you hit with a bite attack, you deal an additional 1d6 damage of your Dragon's Breath damage type.

options.name: Darting Predator
options.description: You adapt to better surprise your foes with short bursts of speed. You can take the Dash action as a bonus action.

options.name: Drowning Terror
options.description: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water. Whenever you grapple a target that is unable to breathe freely-such as an aquatic creature on land or vice versa-at the start of each of its turns, the target of your grapple must succeed on a Wisdom save against your Dragon Spark DC or become frightened of drowning until it can again breathe freely. Additionally, when you are dragging or carrying a grappled creature with you, your speed is no longer halved.

options.name: Skewering Quills
options.description: You develop clusters of sharp quills along your limbs which you can fire in an arc at your foes. You gain a quills natural weapon, which counts as a martial ranged weapon for you and which you are proficient with. You can use them to make ranged weapon attacks with a range of 60/120, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with them. On a hit, they deal 1d10 piercing damage. Hit or miss, one square occupied by the targeted creature is then filled with quills, and you can additionally choose two squares within 5 feet of that square to also fill with quills as your inaccurate bombardment harmlessly scatters across the area. Any creature that subsequently enters a square filled with quills must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save. You can use this attack a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), after which you must finish a short or long rest to use it again.

options.name: Thorny Spines
options.description: You grow a series of sharp, slender spikes across your body. Any enemy that deals damage to you in melee suffers 1d4 piercing damage. At the start of each of your turns you deal 1d4 piercing damage to any creature grappling you or any creature grappled by you.

options.name: Breath of Bolstering Essence
options.description: Your magical essence is a wellspring of vitality waiting to be shared. As an action, you exhale revitalizing power unto a creature of your choice within 10 feet of you, restoring a number of hit points equal to your demi-dragon level. At your option, you can expend one or more of your Hit Dice, up to half your demi-dragon level. For each Hit Die spent in this way, roll the die then add your Constitution modifier, and add the result to the total amount of hit points you restore to the target. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

options.name: Enthralling Dragonsong
options.description: You can sing a wordless aria that pacifies your audience. As a bonus action and on each subsequent turn while your song lasts, every creature of your choice within 20 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Dragon Spark or become charmed by you until your song ends. A creature that cannot hear you or which has successfully saved against your song is immune to this use of your song. The song ends after 1 minute, if you are incapacitated, or if you do not maintain it with a bonus action each turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

options.name: Numinous Dragonsong
options.description: As a bonus action, you can sing a wordless hymn that guides your allies. Your song lasts until the start of your next turn, and while it lasts you and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of you gain a bonus to death saving throws and Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration equal to your dragon spark ability score modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). While singing, you gain blindsight out to 10 feet. If you already have blindsight, it instead increases by 10 feet. The song ends if you are incapacitated or if you do not maintain it with a bonus action each turn.

options.name: Shape Breath
options.description: When you breathe destructive energy, you can shape pockets of relative safety within the area of your breath. When you use your Dragon's Breath feature, you can choose a number of creatures that are within the area of the breath weapon and which you can see equal to 1 + your dragon spark ability score modifier (minimum 1). The chosen creatures need not make a saving throw, and take no damage from your Dragon's Breath.

options.name: Draining Scales
options.description: You alter your scales to siphon magical energy. Whenever you are a target of any spell of 1st level or higher, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) before the spell's effects are resolved.

options.name: Silver Mist
options.description: You take on the aspect of the silver dragon, and can walk on clouds. As a reaction that you can take at any time when you or another creature that is Large or smaller within 60 feet of you falls, you can create a cloud beneath the target as a reaction. The cloud supports the creature's weight and can harmlessly break their fall as if it were a physical object. As part of creating the cloud, you can choose to have it immediately move up to 10 feet up or down, where it will then float in place for up to 1 hour, or until you create a new one.

options.name: Chameleon Scales
options.description: Your scales gain the ability to change color, letting you blend in with your surroundings. You can take the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. You have advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in dim light and in natural terrain, such as rocks, plants, or sand.

options.name: Venemous Sting
options.description: Your tail develops a stinger, loaded with poison. Your tail attack deals your choice of piercing or bludgeoning damage. When you deal damage with a tail attack, you can choose to inject the target with poison. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC. On a failure, the target takes an additional 2d6 poison damage and is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

options.name: Skittering Crawl
options.description: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. If you move at least 20 feet on the ground or as part of a climb, you can choose to take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

options.name: Snatching Tail
options.description: Your tail becomes flexible, letting you unexpectedly catch your foes and yank them around. When you hit a creature that is up to one size category larger than you with your tail, you can choose to force them to roll a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failure, they are pulled to a space of your choosing within 10 feet of you. The space must be on the ground and unoccupied.

name: War Plating
description:
You've trained in wearing heavy armor into combat. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with heavy armor.
  • When you don a heavy armor, you can choose to forgo using its AC calculation. If you do, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical attacks is reduced by 3.
  • Wearing heavy armor no longer restricts the Flight or Stride features.

name: Hardy Hibernator
description:
Like bears, you are capable of hibernating for a long time without food. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • As long as you otherwise eat at normal levels, you can go for up to three months without food.
  • You have a burrow speed of 10 feet. You can tunnel through loose dirt, gravel, and similar materials, but not through solid materials. If you burrow at half speed, you can reinforce your tunnel as you move, letting others safely pass through—otherwise it slowly collapses behind you.

name: Baphomet's Fury
description:
You have trained to use your horns as effectively as any weapon. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Your Goring Charge can now target multiple enemies. When used in this way, you can target a number of creatures up to your proficiency bonus, and you can move through their spaces without triggering any opportunity attacks.
  • If you drop below half your maximum hit points, you regain a use of your Goring Charge feature. You can only recover a use in this way once per long rest.

name: Wild Constitution
description:
You embody your species's legendary resilience. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • As a reaction, you can reduce any instance of damage you receive by a number equal to your proficiency modifier.
  • When you would fail a Strength or Constitution saving throw, you may reroll it and use the new roll. You can use this feature once, regaining its use after a short or long rest.

name: Blood Frenzy
description:
You gain a frenzied blood sense that you can hardly control, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom score by 1.
  • You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures below half of their maximum hit points if the target is within 100 feet of you.

name: Ghastly Stench
description: You grow in power, transforming from a ghoul into a ghast, and gaining the ability to exude the stench of death. As a bonus action, you can force each creature within 5 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, a creature is poisoned until the start of your next turn.

name: Bestial Countenance
description:
The beast within gains more power over you, and even begins to seep through while you aren't shifted. You gain the following benefits:
  • Your Constitution or Wisdom score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain one of the following additional features depending on your subrace.

traits.name: Tough Hide
traits.description: You reduce all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage you take by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

traits.name: Wind Gliding
traits.description: As a reaction you can take when falling while you aren't prone or wearing heavy armor, you can spread your skin membranes and glide, slowing your rate of descent to 20 feet per round. While gliding, you can as part of your movement move up to 40 feet in any horizontal direction, or dive straight down. When you land, you take no falling damage and can land on your feet. You can also start gliding by expending at least 10 feet of movement as part of a high jump.

traits.name: Tearing Claws
traits.description: Once per turn when you deal piercing or slashing damage, you can cause the target to become bleeding (1d6) for 1 minute.  An affected creature can make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus), ending the effect on themselves on a successful saving throw.

traits.name: Slink Away
traits.description: You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Hunter's Eye
traits.description:
You learn the Hunter's Mark spell. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it. You can cast Hunter's Mark without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

While you are shifted, you can cast Hunter's Mark at 1st level at will, without expending a spell slot.

name: Crab's Resilience
description:
Your body possesses the innate resilience of crabs and lobsters. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution by 1.
  • If you lose a body part, you can re-grow it over the course of 1d4 long rests.
  • When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

name: Feline Grace
description:
Your incredible reflexes and agility further improve. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can use your Feline Agility trait twice before you must move 0 feet on one of your turns to use the trait again. You can still only use this ability once per turn when you move.
  • You don't take damage from falling 20 feet or less if you aren't incapacitated.

name: Precision Claws
description:
Your claws are particularly precise. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can use your claws as thieves' tools. You are proficient with using your claws in this way, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for such a check.

name: Prehensile Trunk
description:
Your trunk has grown more dexterous and proficient. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Your trunk can fully act as a third arm. The trunk can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

name: Dexterous Tentacles
description:
Your tentacles have grown more dexterous and proficient. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Your tentacles can act as a third arm. The tentacles can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

name: Biological Chimerism
description:
You further modify your body to suit your needs. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain an additional animal enhancement from the options available at 1st level.

name: Aether Body
description: You tap into the aether forming your body and spirit and use it to fuel your magic.  Spells you cast ignore resistance to force damage. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals force damage, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

name: Full Gallop
description:
Excelling at high speed, you can rapidly move across the land. You gain the following benefits:
  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You can take the Dash action as a bonus action.
  • When you are alone, your travel pace is increased by 1 mile per day.

name: Wings of the Night
description: One of your ancestors was a cornugon, vrock, or similar winged fiend.  You manifest the wings of a creature of the night, such as a bat or skeletal dragon, which grant you a flying speed equal to your walking speed while you are not wearing medium or heavy armor.

name: Dragon Wings
description: You sprout large wings resembling those of a dragon, which grant you a flying speed equal to your walking speed while you are not wearing medium or heavy armor.

name: Barbed Hide
description:
One of your ancestors was a hamatula or other spiky fiend. Barbs protrude from your head. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Charisma score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. If you're already proficient in it, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with it.
  • As a bonus action, you can cause small barbs to protrude all over your body or cause them to retract. At the start of each of your turns while the barbs are out, you deal 1d6 piercing damage to any creature grappling you or any creature grappled by you.

name: Fearless
description:
Though all kender are brave, you have a reptuation for being particularly fearless, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You are immune to the frightened condition.

name: Call to the Woods
description:
You have gained the ability to share a little bit of the innate magic that animates you, at least for a time. As an action, you can touch a tree or shrub within 5 feet of you and awaken it, transforming it into an awakened tree or awakened shrub.

The awakened plant is friendly towards you, though it is under no obligation to obey your commands. It remains awakened for 1 hour, at which point it reverts to a normal plant.

You can awaken a plant once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Handy
description:
You gain a greater understanding of technology and artifice, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Technology skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You gain proficiency with two sets of tools of your choice.

name: Socialite
description:
You have a knack for fitting in and understanding culture, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Society skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you have spent at least 1 hour interacting with people of a certain culture, you can pass yourself off as a member of that culture.

name: Enduring
description:
You are remarkably resilient, able to withstand a great deal of hardship, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in the Endurance skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes.
  • You can go up to 2 weeks without food before you suffer any ill effects.
  • You can go up to 5 days without water before you suffer any ill effects.
  • You can choose to remain awake during a long rest without suffering a level of exhaustion. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest without reminaing awake before you can do so again.

name: Fell Body
description:
You've learned to merge with the shadows around you. You gain the following benefits:
  • Your Dexterity score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can see in magical darkness as if it was non-magical.
  • You are resistant to necrotic damage.
  • You do not require sleep.

name: Shadow Walker
description:
Fell magic runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience possess by other Shadowfell denizens while enhancing your nocturnian qualities. You gain the following benefits:
  • You can use your Shade Walk trait to move a maximum additional distance equal to your base walking speed instead of half.
  • As an action, while within 5 feet of another creature, you can step into that creature's shadow and remain there. While in a creature's shadow you occupy the same space as the creature, are considered invisible and cannot affect your surroundings. As an action or if you take any damage leave that creature's shadow, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet.

name: Brutal Brawler
description:
You fight dirty, brutal, and with whatever is necessary. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Brutal Exploits of your choice from among those available to the brawler class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Wild Soul
description:
You are at home in the wilderness, and you are an expert survivalists. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Wild Exploits of your choice from among those available to the nomad class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Deadeye Shot
description:
Your eye is sharp and your hand is quick. You gain the following benefits.
  • You learn two Deadeye Exploits of your choice from among those available to the gunslinger class. If an exploit you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.
  • You gain one exploit die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any exploit dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your exploits. A exploit die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended exploit dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You can take this feat multiple times, and gain additional exploit dice and exploit options each time.

name: Rune Carver
description:
You've studied the magic of Jiganti runes, granting you the following benefits:
  • You know the Comprehend Languages spell and can cast it at will, but only as a ritual. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.
  • You learn three Runes of your choice. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher, you can invoke one of these runes to modify the spell's effects. You can invoke runes a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Jotunn Magic
description:
You have learned the runic magic of the giants, gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength, Constitution, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1.
  • Choose a type of giant. You gain additional benefits based on your choice.
You can take this feat multiple times, and must choose a different kind of giant each time.

traits.name: Maelstrom Aura
traits.description: As a bonus action, you surround yourself with an aura of magical wind and lightning that extends 10 feet from you in every direction but not through total cover. The aura lasts until the start of your next turn or until you are incapacitated. While the aura is active, you have resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and whenever another creature starts its turn within the aura, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Cloudy Escape
traits.description: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that attack's damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Born of Flame
traits.description: You gain resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Searing Ignition
traits.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to 1d8 + your proficiency bonus, and it has the blinded condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus (but no more than once per turn), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Born of Ice
traits.description: You gain resistance to cold damage.

traits.name: Frigid Retaliation
traits.description: Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes cold damage equal to 1d8 + your proficiency bonus, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Cavernous Sight
traits.description: You gain darkvision out to 60 feet.

traits.name: Stone Throw
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can conjure a boulder and throw it. Make a ranged weapon attack against a creature or object within 60 feet of you. On a hit, the rock deals 1d10 force damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat) or be knocked prone. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Bulwark
traits.description: When you are subjected to an effect that would move you at least 5 feet or knock you prone, you can use your reaction to steady yourself and negate the effect.

traits.name: Iron Stomach
traits.description: Whenever you eat food as part of a short rest and spend one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points, you regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus.

name: Jotunn Strike
description: You have absorbed primeval magic that gives you an echo of the might of giants.  Choose a type of giant.  Once per turn, when you hit a target with a melee weapon attack or a ranged weapon attack using a thrown weapon, you can imbue the attack with an additional effect depending on the type of giant you chose.  The saving throw DC for these effects equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Constitution modifier. You can use this feat a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.description: The target takes an extra 1d6 lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

The target takes an extra 1d6 thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or you become invisible to it until the start of your next turn or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.
The target takes an extra 2d6 fire damage.
The target takes an extra 1d6 cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.
The target takes an extra 1d6 force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet from you in a straight line.
The target takes an extra 1d6 damage of the weapon's type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Death Roll
description:
You master the signature technique of the crocodile, the fearsome death roll. While grappling a creature with your jaws, you can use your action to death roll, forcing the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, a target takes slashing damage equal to the normal damage of your bite attack and is stunned until the end of your next turn, taking half as much damage and not being stunned on a successful save. If you reduce the target to 0 hit points, they lose one limb of your choice.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Dungeonsense
description:
You've developed a connection with inside spaces. You gain the following benefits:
  • As an action, you can touch a wall, floor, or ceiling and peer through it. Until the start of your next turn, you can see and hear as if you were in the nearest space on the other side of the surface. You can't perceive through a wall, floor, or ceiling that is greater than 5 feet thick, and a layer of lead of any thickness blocks your abilities to perceive through it.
  • Whenever you make an Intelligence check to determine the purpose or origin of a room, you are considered proficient in the check and add double your proficiency bonus, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
  • Your teeny scout has blindsight out to 30 feet.

name: Rapid Healing
description:
Your rough and tumble way of life leaves you with many wounds, but your superior regeneration rapidly heals your injuries. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You regain a single Hit Die whenever you finish a short rest.
  • When you use your Vermin Recovery trait, you can choose to spend multiple Hit Dice at once, up to an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. You add your Constitution modifier to each Hit Die you spend, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the total, rounded up.

name: Nine Lives
description:
Your luck makes you exceedingly hard to kill, leading to a myth that you have nine lives. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When you fail a death saving throw, you may instead succeed. You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

name: Dire Blood
description:
You latently grow a powerful wild aspect, that of a dire beast, marking you as a fabled forest warrior. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You regain a single Hit Die whenever you finish a short rest.
  • You grow a wild aspect appendage that takes the form of the defining characteristic of a forest creature, such as a set of antlers, talons, or tusks. The appendage counts as a natural weapon and it deals 1d10 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, whichever is most appropriate for the appendage. You can choose to use either your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your appendage. Attacks with this special appendage are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical damage.

name: Pesky Demolitionist
description:
You're an adaptable, chaotic force of destruction. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • The extra damage you deal with your Dismantle trait is no longer halved.
  • As a bonus action on your turn, you can analyze an object or construct that you can see and plan for a crushing blow. The first attack roll that you make against the object or construct before the end of your turn is a critical hit if you roll a 15 or higher on the d20 for your attack roll. Once you score a critical hit using this feat, you can't use this bonus action again until you finish a long rest.

name: Myriad Pockets
description:
Your pocket dimension has subdivided and grown, allowing you to store more items and even creatures. You gain the following benefits:
  • Two invisible, intangible bags of holding float around you within your space. Only you can access the bags of holding, and they both empty when you are reduced to 0 hit points.
  • Using your Hidden Pockets trait, you can touch another willing Medium or smaller creature as an action and transport them to your pocket dimension. The creature is incapacitated while in your pocket dimension, and it can remain in your pocket dimension up to 1 minute or until you lose concentration, at which point they appear safely on the ground in the nearest unoccupied space of your choice. Once you transport a creature into your pocket dimension, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

name: Somniloquist
description:
You learn how to materialize your dreams while you are sleeping. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • While you are unconscious, you can see and hear your surroundings out to a range of 5 feet. Your perception while unconscious doesn't rely on your eyes and ears, but rather appears to you in your dreams.
  • At the end of your turn while you are unconscious, you can choose to mumble in your sleep and cause a wild magic surge. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for any spells you cast as a result of this surge. You can mumble in your sleep a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Chef
description:
Time and effort spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with cook's utensils. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • As part of a short rest, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your proficiency bonus. At the end of the short rest, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra 1d8 hit points.
  • With one hour of work or when you finish a long rest, you can cook a number of treats equal to your proficiency bonus from the options below. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a bonus action to eat one of those treats to gain its benefits.

subFeatures.name: Fortifying Ration
subFeatures.description: Upon consumption, the creature chooses either Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution. For the next minute, the creature can add your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1) to any ability check or saving throw for the chosen ability score.

subFeatures.name: Invigorating Ration
subFeatures.description: Upon consumption, the creature regains hit points equal to 1d10 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

subFeatures.name: Revitalizing Ration
subFeatures.description: Upon consumption, the creature ends one of the following conditions currently affecting it: blindness, deafness, poison, or they reduce their exhaustion level by 1.

subFeatures.name: Stimulating Ration
subFeatures.description: This Ration must be consumed as part of a short rest. Upon consumption, the creature gains advantage on the roll for any Hit Dice they choose to expend during that short rest.

name: Alchemist
description:
You have studied the secrets of alchemy and are an expert in using alchemical creations to aid you. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You are considered proficient with attack rolls made with alchemical creations.
  • Over the course of a long rest if you have your alchemist's supplies, you can improve the potency of a healing potion. If a creature drinks the potion before your next long rest, they can forgo rolling for the number of hit points restored to instead take the maximum amount.

name: Blacksmith
description:
You have spent time in the forge, working with metal and flame to craft weapons and armor. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with blacksmith's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with blacksmithing.
  • Over the course of a long rest if you have your blacksmith's tools, you can improve a weapon, suit of armor, or shield. Weapons gain a +1 bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and armor and shields gain a +1 bonus to the AC they provide. The benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.
  • You gain a bonus to saving throws against effects that deal fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
  • You gain proficiency with light hammers, bec de corbins, longhammers, mauls, and warhammers.

name: Master of Disguise
description:
You have honed your ability to shape your personality and to read the personalities of others. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with the disguise kit. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You craft a single magical mask of your choice from the following list. As an action, you can don the mask, and gain its benefits for the next hour. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Aristocratic Mask
traits.description:
A mask designed to replicate the look of a noble lord or lady, often crafted with ostentatious and luxurious materials.

While wearing this mask, you have advantage on Charisma checks you make towards common folk, so long as they are friendly towards you and your allies. In addition, creatures will believe you to be a member of the nobility unless you give them a reason to think otherwise.

traits.name: Barbaric Mask
traits.description:
A mask created to resemble a wild warrior or beast of the wilderness, often crafted with raw, crude natural materials.

When you don this mask, your current hit points and hit point maximum are increased by an amount equal to half your level. In addition, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from all nonmagical attacks.

traits.name: Devious Mask
traits.description:
A mask crafted to resemble a common criminal or thief, often crafted with dark materials and including a hood or cowl.

While wearing this mask, you can use a bonus action to take the Hide, Disengage, or Use and Object actions.

traits.name: Knightly Mask
traits.description:
This mask is crafted to resemble an armored paragon of chivalry, and is often polished to a shine in the sunlight.

While wearing this mask, you are proficient with martial weapons and you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

In addition, once per turn when you hit a Medium or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 10 feet in a straight line or must drop on object it is holding.

traits.name: Priestly Mask
traits.description:
This mask is crafted to resemble a prophet, saint, or other holy person, often made from delicate yet beautiful materials.

While wearing this Mask, you can use your bonus action restore hit points to one creature that can hear you within 30 feet equal to your Charisma modifier.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Scholarly Mask
traits.description:
This mask is crafted to resemble a distinguished humanoid deep in thought, often crafted from rare and esoteric materials.

While you are wearing this Mask, when you deal damage to a creature with a weapon attack you learn one of the following characteristics about that creature of your choice: its Armor Class, highest ability score, lowest ability score, or its spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Virtuoso Mask
traits.description:
This mask is created to resemble a great performer at home on the stage, often crafted to draw attention and stand out.

Whenever you perform or play an instrument for a creature for at least 1 minute, you have advantage on ability checks you make to influence, interact, or gather information on that creature for the next hour.

name: Counterfeiter
description:
Your time working in professional and seedy environs has granted you able ability to forge falsehoods. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with the forgery kit. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can always remember any seal or signature you have seen before.
  • If you have spent at least 1 hour studying someone's handwriting, you can duplicate it at any point in the future.

name: Healer
description:
You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with the healer's kit. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • When you use a healer's kit to stabilize a creature, the target also regains 1 hit point.
  • As an action. you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and allow it to expend a hit die. The target regains hit points equal to a roll of the hit die plus your healer's kit modifier. The target can't regain hit points from this feature again until it finishes a short or long rest.

name: Herbalist
description:
You are adept at harnessing the useful properties of herbs and other plants. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with the herbalism kit. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • Over the course of a long rest if you have your herbalism kit, you can apply herbal remedies to one creature, curing one nonmagical poison or disease of your choice.

name: Navigator
description:
You know how to navigate through any environment. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with navigator's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you have navigator's tools, you cannot become lost by nonmagical means.
  • You and the creatures you travel with can travel at a fast pace without penalty.

name: Surgeon
description:
You are skilled at the delicate work of surgery. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with the surgery kit. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • When you use a surgery kit to cure an injury, the creature is treated as if it has resistance against the next injury of the same damage type.

name: Poisoner
description:
You can prepare and deliver deadly poisons. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with the poisoner's kit. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can coat a weapon in poison as an object interaction.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

name: Burglar
description:
You have broken many locks, and their mechanisms are familiar to you. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with thieves' tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you successfully pick a lock, you automatically succeed on all checks made to pick the same lock in the future.

name: Tinker
description:
You often spend your free time tinkering with gizmos, thingamabobs, and doohickeys. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with tinker's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with tinkering.
  • Using tinker's tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose an item of Adventuring Equipment that costs 20 gp or less. The device replicates the function of that piece of equipment.

name: Fisher
description:
You are an expert fisher. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with angler's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you have access to a body of water that sustains marine life and your angler's tools, you can catch enough food to feed yourself and up to ten other people each day.
  • You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that have an innate swimming speed.

name: Bartender
description:
You are an expert of brewing delicious beverages. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with brewer's supplies. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If a creature drinks alcohol that you gave to them, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to influence them.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

name: Scribe
description:
You have learned a great deal about writing and magical scrolls. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with calligrapher's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You can identify the handwriting of anyone who you have seen the handwriting of before.
  • When a creature casts a spell using a scroll you created, they can use your Dexterity score as the spellcasting ability.

name: Carpenter
description:
You are skilled with simple woodworking. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with carpenter's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You deal double damage to objects and structures made of wood.
  • You can build wooden structures in half of the required time.
  • You gain proficiency with handaxes, battleaxes, greataxes, and halberds.

name: Cartographer
description:
You have studied the methods and techniques used in making maps. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with cartographer's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you have a map, you cannot become lost by nonmagical means.
  • While you are drawing a map while traveling, you remain alert to danger.
  • You can understand any map, even if you can't understand the language it was written in.
  • Maps that you create can be understood by any creature that can understand a language.

name: Chandler
description:
You are a master of creating insence and candles. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with chandler's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • Candles and insence you craft burn for twice as long.
  • When you craft a block of insence, you can imbue a poison into it, increasing the crafting DC by 3. When the insence is burned, creatures within 10 feet of it that breathe are subjected to the poison used. The insence can be identified as poisonous with an Intelligence (Investigation) check, with a DC equal to 8 + your Chandler's tools modifier.

name: Cobbler
description:
You have experience in the humble trade of shoemaking. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with cobbler's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with cobbling.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can improve a pair of shoes if you have your cobbler's tools. A creature wearing the shoes gains a 5 foot bonus to their walking speed and their movement isn't impeded by nonmagical grounded hazards, such as ball bearings or caltrops. The benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

name: Green Thumb
description:
You are an expert at growing simple plants. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with gardener's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • If you spend 8 hours or more working up to one square mile of viable farmland, the land you work gains the effects of the 8-hour casting of the plant growth spell.

name: Glassblower
description:
You are an expert at creating glasswork. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with glassblower's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with glassblowing.
  • You deal double damage to objects made of glass.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can improve a Medium or smaller glass object if you have your glassblower's tools. The object gains resistance to nonmagical damage. The benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

name: Jeweler
description:
You know how to work jewels to bring out their natural beauty. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with jeweler's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with jewelcrafting.
  • If you spend 1 minute examining a gem or piece of jewelery you are touching, you can ascertain its value, origin, and age.
  • You can reduce the cost of any gemstones required for a spell's material components by half its cost, up to a maximum reduction of 100 gp.

name: Leatherworker
description:
You are an expert at working with hides and leathers. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with leatherworker's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with leatherworking.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can improve a suit of medium or heavy armor if you have your leatherworker's tools. The armor no longer imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. No benefit is granted to fortress plate. The benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

name: Stoneworker
description:
You know how to best create stone structures and statues. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with mason's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You deal double damage to objects and structures made of stone or bricks.
  • You can build stone structures in half of the required time.
  • You gain proficiency with light hammers, bec de corbins, longhammers, mauls, and warhammers.

name: Artist
description:
You pride yourself on your artistic skill and its applications to painting and drawing. You gain the following benefits:
