  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with painter's supplies. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • When you create a painting, you can hide hidden messages in the art. A creature can identify these messages with an Intelligence (Investigation) check, with a DC equal to 8 + your painter's supplies modifier. Over the course of a long rest, you can teach any number of creatures your art style, allowing them to identify your messages without an ability check.
  • You can perfectly recall visual details at any point in the future.

name: Sculptor
description:
You know how to create objects out of clay and imbue them with magic. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with potter's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can imbue a Tiny sculpture you created with magic if you have your potter's tools. The sculpture comes to life as with the Tiny Servant spell, and remains animated until the end of your next long rest.

name: Tailor
description:
You can easily stitch together clothing and outfits, both artistic and functional. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with tailor's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with tailoring.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can improve an outfit of clothing if you have your tailor's tools. The clothing is better adapted to the current environment, and the wearer gains advantage on saving throws made against environmental effects. The benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

name: Weaver
description:
You are an expert in creating cloth and other simple cloth creations. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with weaver's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with weaving.
  • You deal double damage to objects made of cloth.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can improve a Medium or smaller cloth object if you have your weaver's tools. The object gains resistance to nonmagical damage. The benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

name: Whitesmith
description:
You are experienced with the fine finishing work of blacksmithing, and with runecarving. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with whitesmith's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • When you carve a rune onto a magical item, you can reduce the DC increase by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus, to a minimum increase of +0.
  • You can attune to one extra magic item. This additional item must have at least one rune carved onto it.

name: Woodcarver
description:
You are an expert at creating fanciful, artistic objects out of wood. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with woodcarver's tools. If you are already proficient with the tool, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
  • You have advantage on checks made to enchant items made with woodcarving.
  • Over the course of a long rest, you can imbue a Tiny wooden figurine you created with magic if you have your woodcarver's tools. The figurine comes to life as with the Tiny Servant spell, and remains animated until the end of your next long rest.

name: Wind Walker
description:
A master of the wind, you can pick up subtle changes in the air, able to adapt to sudden changes.
  • Your flight speed is increased by 10 feet.
  • You have advantage on saving throws against effects that involve wind. If you succeed on a saving throw against such an effect, you can use your reaction to immediately move up to half your flying speed.
  • In windy conditions, your flight speed is doubled.

name: Fey Luck
description: You are blessed with the luck of fey creatures. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

name: Cold-Blooded
description:
You have learned to work around your physiology, using it to benefit you and gaining the following benefits:
  • Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You have resistance to fire damage when you are in a hot climate, and resistance to cold damage when you are in a cold climate. While in a temperate climate, you may choose which resistance you have when you finish a long rest.

name: Might of the Meager
description:
You may be small, but you are fierce. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You are considered one size larger for determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, and lift.
  • You can wield Heavy and Massive weapons as though you were a Medium creature.
  • You can grapple and drag creatures as though you were a Medium creature.

name: Squat Nimbleness
description:
You are uncommonly nimble for your race. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Increase your walking speed by 5 feet.
  • You gain proficiency in Acrobatics or Athletics.
  • You have advantage on any Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check you make to escape from being grappled.

name: Mechanical Resolve
description:
You gain 3 points of Resolve. You can expend resolve to power the following features:
  • When you make a death saving throw and fail, you may spend a point of Resolve to ignore it.
  • When you would make a Wisdom saving throw but before you do so, you may spend a point of Resolve and make a Constitution saving throw instead.
  • When you make a Constitution saving throw but before being told the outcome of your roll, you may spend a point of Resolve and roll one more time. You must take the new roll.
You regain all expended Resolve points when you finish a long rest.

name: Touch of Orcus
description: Your undead nature draws directly on the demon Orcus, lord of undeath. You learn the Murmurs of the Restless spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn the Ghastly Flight and Drain Life spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for all three spells.

name: Leafspeak
description: You can communicate with the plants with which you share heritage.  When you are speaking Druidic, you can communicate with plants as if you were under the effects of a Speak with Plants spell.

name: Prehensile Tail
description:
Your tail has grown more dexterous and proficient. You gain the following benefits:
  • Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Your tail can act as an additional arm. The tail can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.
